alert.note: Alert for Spokane (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 6:21PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northeast Washington, including the following county, Spokane. * WHEN...Until 815 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 620 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Radar estimates between 0.4 and 0.7 inches of rain have fallen, with isolated amounts estimated near 1 inch. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Spokane, Spokane Valley, Millwood, Dishman, Trentwood, Green Acres, Country Homes, Fairwood, Otis Orchards-East Farms, Opportunity and Veradale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
